purpleculture_pinyin:
bù
spread, publicize, announce
распространять, предавать гласности, объявлять
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: A person 亻 making an announcement 布; 布 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
颁佈 [ bān bù ]: variant of 頒布 |颁布 , to issue; to proclaim; to enact (laws, decrees etc)
宣佈 [ xuān bù ]: variant of 宣布 , to declare
佈建 [ bù jiàn ]: to progressively extend (service delivery, network etc) to a wider area; rollout; also written 布建
頒佈 [ bān bù ]: variant of 颁布 ; to issue; to promulgate
羅佈 [ luó bù ]: variant of 羅布 |罗布 , display; spread out
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 亻 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • 布 [ bù ] cotton, linen, textiles; to announce, to declare; to spread
heisig_chinese_memo: Mr. T gets pretty intense when he makes announcements so he keeps a cloth to wipe his sweat with.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mr. T gets pretty intense when he makes announcements so he keeps a cloth to wipe his sweat with.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " people ", from " cloth ". " Cloth " is the same as " cloth ", which means spreading, arrangement, announcement, etc. "Zhengzitong. "Human Ministry": "Cloth, general cloth."

" Cloth " means distribution and pervasiveness. "Guang Yun. "Evening rhyme": "Cloth, and everywhere." For example, Chapter 39 of "The Romance of the Gods": "Seeing the clouds and clouds together, hide the sun." Lao She "Four Generations in the Same House": "Xiaohe, look at her daughter, see My wife, her face is full of kindness and joy."

" Cloth " means the arrangement and arrangement, as in the 29th chapter of Journey to the West: "The state ministers are all mortals and horses. They learn how to learn military strategies, and they can only encamp the cloth camp and protect the country from invasion of the tomb." Xu Hongzu" Xu Xiake's Travels. "Dian Travel Diary 11": "The master returns to the jurisdiction of Buping."

" Cloth " also means to declare and announce. For example, Chapter 9 of "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms": "Cao et al, I would like to advertise the world with righteousness: Dong Zhuo deceives the heavens and the earth, destroys the country and kills the emperor; impures the palace and bans, and harms the living beings;

" Cloth " also means giving. For example, Volume 35 of "The First Moment Pai An Surprise": "I have to go elsewhere today to ask for these alms." Li Yu in the Qing Dynasty, "Naihetian. "Fleeing Zen": "Please be compassionate and give me alms from the study."
humanum_short_description_en: From " people ", from " cloth ". Same as " cloth ", which means spreading, arrangement, announcement, etc.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」，從「布」。「佈」同「布」，表示遍布、安排、宣告等意思。《正字通．人部》：「佈，通作布。」

　　「佈」表示分布、遍布。《廣韻．暮韻》：「佈，布徧也。」如《封神演義》第39回：「見陰雲佈合，把太陽掩了。」老舍《四世同堂》：「曉荷看看女兒，看看太太，臉上滿佈着慈祥與愉快。」

　　「佈」表示安排、布置，如《西遊記》第29回：「況臣等俱是凡人凡馬，習學兵書武略，止可佈陣安營，保國家無侵陵之患。」徐弘祖《徐霞客遊記．滇遊日記十一》：「主人復投轄佈枰。」

　　「佈」也表示宣告、宣布。如《三國演義》第9回：「操等謹以大義布告天下：董卓欺天罔地，滅國弒君；穢亂宮禁，殘害生靈；狼戾不仁，罪惡充積！」

　　「佈」還表示施予。如《初刻拍案驚奇》卷35：「今要往別處去走走，討這些佈施。」清代李漁《奈何天．逃禪》：「求你大捨慈悲，把書房佈施與我。」
humanum_short_description: 從「人」，從「布」。同「布」，表示遍布、安排、宣告等意思。

    • 布 [ bù ] cotton, linen, textiles; to announce, to declare; to spread

宣佈 [ xuān bù ]: variant of 宣布 , to declare
佈建 [ bù jiàn ]: to progressively extend (service delivery, network etc) to a wider area; rollout; also written 布建
頒佈 [ bān bù ]: variant of 颁布 ; to issue; to promulgate

Liushutong characters (2)

佈字的基本解释

佈
bù
同“布”③佈⑥。

佈字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bù］
［《廣韻》博故切，去暮，幫。］
(1)铺开；分布。
(2)分物与人；施予。参见“佈施”。
(3)将菜肴分敬席上的人。
(4)安排；安置。参见“佈局”、“佈景”。
(5)公开宣示。参见“佈告”。
(6)陈说；陈述。参见“佈覆”、“佈達”。

佈字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　佈； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页98第01
【廣韻】【集韻】【正韻】?博故切，音布。徧也。　通作布抪。

佈字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
佈字的起名意思

布的异体字。

cloth

cloth

cloth
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bù］
["Guangyun" interpret the story, go to the evening, help. ]
(1) Spread out; distribute.
(2) Separate things and people; give. See "giving".
(3) Distribute the dishes to the people on the table.
(4) Arrangement; resettlement. See "layout", "setup".
(5) Public announcement. See "Notice".
(6) Chen said; statement. See "cloth covering", "buda".
cloth
